# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily focused on two main projects: Valiant's race system and Lastraum's Tile Dash game. Valiant announced a working race system with persistent storage for leaderboards, inviting others to test it. The system includes start/finish lines and gates that players must pass through, with a warning about "bad normals" causing issues. Lastraum shared updates about Tile Dash becoming multiplayer with improved FPS, restart logic, and mobile compatibility. Performance issues were discussed when .hyp shaman reported low FPS despite having a 5060 Ti GPU. Lastraum identified that 3D models ported from DCL were causing performance problems and removed them to improve performance. There was also a technical discussion about NLA tracks not being supported in Hyperfy. Ash mentioned plans for occlusion culling but noted it wasn't a current priority. Later, Lastraum added a token reward system to Tile Dash where players can earn 25 tokens for completing a level. The chat concluded with a discussion between Ash and Lastraum about implementing physics in DCL, with Lastraum explaining they use server-simulated physics with client-side colliders to prevent players from walking through objects.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How does Lastraum implement physics in DCL without players walking through objects? (asked by ash) A: Server simulated physics and client side colliders block players from going through objects, with Colyseus server for WebSocket connections (answered by Lastraum - theforgecore.xyz)
Q: Is occlusion culling in the latest dev? (asked by .hyp shaman) A: No, it got pushed aside but there are plans for it (answered by ash)
Q: Are NLA tracks supported? (asked by .hyp shaman) A: No, they're not supported yet (answered by Valiant)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: .hyp shaman | Helpee: Lastraum - theforgecore.xyz | Context: Performance issues with 3D models | Resolution: Suggested using glb.babylonpress.org for optimization and using .webp format and LODs

Helper: Valiant | Helpee: Lastraum - theforgecore.xyz | Context: Issues with NLA tracks causing matrix transform errors | Resolution: Suggested stripping them out

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around community dynamics and tensions rather than technical discussions. A key point of contention involves a community member named Saori who appears to have left the project but continues to criticize it externally. Ash (likely the project lead) expresses frustration about this situation, stating that despite Saori's criticism, he still uses Hyperfy's technology. The community largely rallies behind Ash, expressing confidence in the project's direction. There's brief mention of a game called "Tile Dash" developed by Lastraum, which integrates with "The Forge" and includes a leaderboard system with LSC token rewards. Ash tests the game and provides feedback about difficulty issues, particularly with the first level and how the game sometimes starts with lines directly under the player's feet, causing immediate game over scenarios. Lastraum clarifies that there's a green safe zone in each level and that the objective is to collect tiles rather than complete levels.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is there anyone who can inform us more clearly about Saori's comments on token management? (asked by Saracismo) A: Partial answer by ash indicating Saori has a large token allocation but hasn't "top blasted his huge NFT airdrop"
Q: What's the objective in Tile Dash? (implied by ash's comments) A: The objective is to get as many tiles as you can, not necessarily how many levels (answered by Lastraum - theforgecore.xyz)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Lastraum - theforgecore.xyz | Helpee: ash | Context: Difficulty issues with Tile Dash game, particularly with game over scenarios at the start | Resolution: Lastraum explained there's a green safe zone in each level and clarified the game objective is collecting tiles, not completing levels

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Fix issue with Tile Dash game where lines appear under player's feet causing immediate game over | Description: Game sometimes starts with player in unwinnable position | Mentioned By: ash
Feature: Leaderboard integration for Tile Dash game | Description: Lastraum mentioned adding a leaderboard to the game in World | Mentioned By: Lastraum - theforgecore.xyz
